page.title: 10SOCIAL CONCERNS: The Bins
page.content: During 1981 homes in the Brandlesholme area of Bury took part in a pilot study for a new refuse collection system.The new system replaced the traditional dustbin with a larger wheeled and lidded container (known locally as the 'wheelie bin').Residents of Brandlesholme feel the 'wheelie bin' has many advantages over the traditional dustbin, these being:-{(1)}The new bin has 2.5 times the capacity of the old,{(2)}Garden refuse is accepted free of charge,{(3) The hinged lid ensures that dogs and cats cannot scavenge. Some elderly residents found difficulty in wheeling their bins to the boundary of their property on collection day - special arrangements have been made for them.
